<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
PVC pending
**Expected behavior:**
PVC created
**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
download the v1.0.0 release, create the `common.yaml`, `operator.yaml` and `cluster.yaml` ressources from the `cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph` folder and run the `wordpress.yaml` example
**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):Linux master-serv 4.9.93-mainline-rev1
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Scaleway
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): v1.0.0
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.14.2
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): Single node cluster
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_WARN Reduced data availability: 100 pgs inactive`
title: PVC pending forever
